result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephan G Lawrenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
and Substance Abuse Programs.  
Sentence credit of 490 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. May be served in Dane County. LAST 30 days are Stayed for use at agent's discretion. To report on 12/01/2017 by 4pm.
11/28/2017 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR CHANGE IN HUBER REPORT DATE TO 12/27/2017 AT 4PM.
12/21/2017 AFTER INCLUDING GOOD TIME CREDIT AND TIME FOR STRAIGHT JAIL, THE COURT ORDERED THAT DEFENDANT SERVE 23 DAYS IN THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL (WITHOUT HUBER OR ANY OTHER RELEASE).  DEFENDANT IS TO REPORT AT 12/27/2017 by 4:00 PM. LAST 30 DAYS ARE STAYED FOR USE BY AGENT.
To be performed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

Defendant Stephan G Lawrenz appeared by phone.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will modify the sentence.  The defendant was sentenced to 90-days condition time.  30-days will remain for the probation agent to use if he/she needs to.  The defendant is to serve 60-days in the Waukesha County Jail (Court gives the defendant 15-days credit for good time and court takes time off because the defendant will serve the remaining time straight time).  Court indicates that the defendant will serve 23-days straight time in the Waukesha County Jail.  He is to report to the Waukesha County Jail on 12-27-17  by 4:00 p.m.  Waukesha County Jail to set his release date per their policies.
Review hearing on December 21, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Stephan G Lawrenz in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Nicholas Hendriksen from the City of Waukesha, Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Chesshir. Detective Koeppel from the City of Waukesha, sworn in and testified. State's exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by Atty. Chesshir. Redirect by Atty. Boese. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over. Atty. Chesshir provides closing statements and requests dismissal of Count #2.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Court denies the request to dismiss Count #2. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed. Atty. Chesshir requests defendant be sent back to Dane County immediately. Defendant to be returned to Dane County.  Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
